nodes.title: Digital Markets Act (DMA)
nodes.short_description: EU law requiring Apple to allow alternative app marketplaces and payment options in the EU.

nodes.title: Google Play
nodes.short_description: Android app marketplace competing with App Store, influencing policy and pricing dynamics.

nodes.title: European Union
nodes.short_description: Jurisdiction enforcing DMA and antitrust decisions shaping iOS app distribution.

nodes.title: United States
nodes.short_description: Primary market and jurisdiction for major App Store litigation and enforcement.

nodes.title: Telecommunications Business Act (South Korea) amendment
nodes.short_description: Law mandating third-party in-app payment options on app stores in South Korea.

nodes.title: South Korea
nodes.short_description: First country to legislate app store payment choice, forcing App Store changes.

nodes.title: Spotify
nodes.short_description: High-profile complainant driving EU antitrust action and anti-steering scrutiny of App Store.

nodes.title: Japan
nodes.short_description: Regulatory pressure via JFTC led to external link allowances for reader apps.

nodes.title: Netherlands ACM order on iOS dating app payments
nodes.short_description: Regulatory order requiring third-party payments for dating apps on iOS in Netherlands.

nodes.title: Netherlands
nodes.short_description: ACM enforcement compelled alternative payments for iOS dating apps, prompting compliance changes.
